intro: Ligusticopsis scapiformis, commonly known as the slender ligusticum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent similar to other members of the carrot family. Ligusticopsis scapiformis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
